history.content:
CS 70 with/after 189 is total bonkers! You'd have to take 70 before 140/126/189. It is a lower division class that is fundamental to your success in the upper division classes you are talking about.

Also, CS 70 is an introduction to Probability theory class. How can you presumably take 126 (which is an advanced probability course) before it?

CS 70 with/after 189 is total bonkers! You'd have to take 70 before 140/126/189. It is a lower division class that is fundamental to your success in the upper division classes you are talking about.

Also, CS 70 is an introduction to Probability theory class. How can you presumably take 126 (which is an advanced probability course)?

CS 70 with/after 189 is total bonkers! You'd have to take 70 before 140/126/189. It is a lower division class that is fundamental to your success in the upper division classes you are talking about.

Also you seem to have no clue. CS 70 is an introduction to Probability theory class. How can you presumably take 126 (which is an advanced probability course)?
CS 70 with 189 is total bonkers! You'd have to take 70 before 140/126.

children.subject: Yes, you can take 140 after the prerequisites listed but certainly not 126/189 before 70.

How important are proofs? I've already taken an intro to probability class and a couple other probability classes. I was thinking of delaying 70 until senior year (2020). and taking 140&127 next semester and then 189&126

There's a reason 70 is required and that there are no approved substitutes - it's a very unique class that's very fundamental to many of these upper division classes. Is there a reason you're in such a rush to take 189? If you're seriously thinking of going into ML as a career, I would think it's far more important to get your fundamentals right.
You're right, no need to rush 189. I'll take it senior year and focus on my fundamentals first.
(Anon from two comments up here) Thought I stand by my comment, take it with a grain of salt, because I'm not much into ML myself. Should've added that disclaimer. Good luck, OP :)
Above anon, taking 127 right now and it is extremely proof-heavy so I strongly suggest Math 110/54 before 127 or at the minimu, CS 70.
Also, see @6363, Prof Sahai explains why you need CS 70 necessarily before EECS 126.
CS 70 is not a fundamental class just for ML, but for all upper division classes in EECS. Delaying it is strongly not advised.
Really? On the course info for Prob 140 it doesn't list CS70 as a prerequisite. Just Calculus and Linear Algebra

I'll go a bit against the grain here and offer *my opinions*

70 sucks. Like actually. If you're not CS-declared, taking Prob 140 before 70 would be how I wish I could've done it because probability in 70 goes fast and 140 will help you get a good grade in 70 (and thus declare). I feel like its also probably a good ramp up in difficult to the kinds of questions you'll be asked in 70/126/127/189 without it being too high stakes. 

Would also recommend 126 before 189 and I'll echo the "bonkers" comment from above. Don't load up on ridiculous schedules for the sake of it.

history.content:
Hi, I need help deciding between these schedules to prepare for CS189. These are assuming I can take Prob 140/EE126 concurrently with CS189(?), and CS70 concurrently with EE127/CS189(?)

1. Fall 2018 - CS70, EE127

    Spring 2019 - Prob 140, CS189

2. Fall 2018 - Prob 140, EE127

    Spring 2019 - CS70, CS189

3. Fall 2018 - CS70, EE127

    Spring 2019 - EE126, CS189
